entries.meaning: The state or quality of being irritable; quick excitability
(physiology) A natural susceptibility, characteristic of all living organisms, tissues, and cells, to the influence of certain stimuli, response being manifested in a variety of ways.
examples: There is growth only in plants; but there is irritability, or, a better word, instinctivity, in insects.

entries.meaning: (medicine) A condition of morbid excitability of an organ or part of the body; undue susceptibility to the influence of stimuli.
